DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , non-controlled study use healthy adult volunteer subject receive bilateral proximal humerus intraosseous ( IO ) vascular access evaluate insertion technique IO infusion flow rate .

An alternate proximal humerus IO insertion technique develop meet need anesthesia patient positioning use slightly distal insertion site superior angle insertion . However infusion flow rate proximal humerus use anesthesia technique measure . This study need evaluate anesthesia proximal humerus IO insertion technique determine IO infusion flow rate remain unchanged alternate method .
DOC.criteria: Age 21 year old Have amputation upper extremity Able lay flat table 2 hour Selfreported healthy , confirm PI Have active infection body Imprisoned Pregnant Cognitively impaired Fracture humerus , significant trauma site Excessive tissue and/or absence adequate anatomical landmark humerus Infection target area Humeral IO insertion past 48 hour , prosthetic limb joint significant orthopedic procedure humerus Current use anticoagulant Current cardiac condition require pacemaker antiarrhythmic drug Prior adverse reaction lidocaine Volunteers follow characteristic may exclude infusion pathway evaluation involve administration contrast dye discretion PI .
